message.content: This question requires knowledge about the respiratory systems of different animals. Gills are respiratory organs that allow aquatic animals, such as fish like flounders, to intake oxygen from water. Option (B) is incorrect because giraffes are terrestrial animals and do not have gills. Option (C) is partially correct because seals and herons do respire through different mechanisms, but not specifically through gills. Option (D) is incorrect because while some sea-going birds may have specialized respiratory systems, it does not involve gills.

This question requires knowledge about the respiratory systems of different organisms. Gills are specialized organs found in fish and some other aquatic animals that allow them to intake oxygen from the water. Option (B) is incorrect because giraffes do not have gills and cannot breathe underwater. Option (C) is partially correct as seals and some species of herons also use gills for respiration, but it does not cover all animals that have gills. Option (D) is incorrect because sea-going birds, such as penguins and albatrosses, do not have gills and instead have other adaptations for respiration.

This question requires knowledge of animal anatomy and respiration. Gills are respiratory organs that allow fish, like flounders, to intake oxygen from water. Option (B) is incorrect because giraffes are land animals and do not have gills. Option (C) is partially correct, as seals and herons do have respiratory systems, but they do not have gills. Option (D) is also incorrect because sea-going birds, like penguins, have lungs for respiration, not gills.

Option (D) is incorrect because sea-going birds, such as seagulls, also have lungs for respiration.
